content:
Description

{{Manually Enter Description Here}}

AzureRM.Profile Cmdlets

Add-AzureRmAccount

Adds an authenticated account to use for Azure Resource Manager cmdlet requests.

Add-AzureRmEnvironment

Adds endpoints and metadata for an instance of Azure Resource Manager.

Disable-AzureRmDataCollection

Opts out of collecting data to improve the AzurePowerShell cmdlets. Data is not collected unless you explicitly opt in.

Enable-AzureRmDataCollection

Enables Azure PowerShell to collect data to improve the user experience with AzurePowerShell cmdlets. Executing this cmdlet opts in to data collection for the current user on the current machine. No data is collected unless you explicitly opt in.

Get-AzureRmContext

Gets the metadata used to authenticate Azure Resource Manager requests.

Get-AzureRmEnvironment

Get endpoints and metadata for an instance of Azure services.

Get-AzureRmSubscription

Get subscriptions that the current account can access.

Get-AzureRmTenant

Gets tenants that are authorized for the current user.

Remove-AzureRmEnvironment

Removes endpoints and metadata for connecting to a given Azure instance.

Save-AzureRmProfile

Saves the current authentication information for use in other PowerShell sessions.

Select-AzureRmProfile

Loads Azure authentication information from a file.

Set-AzureRmContext

Sets the tenant, subscription, and environment for cmdlets to use in the current session.

Set-AzureRmEnvironment

Sets properties for an Azure environment.
